title: Hoon Lee
text:
Tong Hoon Lee (born July 18, 1973) is an American stage, film and television actor, known for playing Job in the <a href="Cinemax">Cinemax</a> original series "<a href="Banshee%20%28TV%20series%29">Banshee</a>" and the King in the Broadway revival of "<a href="The%20King%20and%20I">The King and I</a>", and voicing <a href="Hamato%20Yoshi">Hamato Yoshi</a>/<a href="Splinter%20%28Teenage%20Mutant%20Ninja%20Turtles%29">Splinter</a> in the 2012 version of "<a href="Teenage%20Mutant%20Ninja%20Turtles%20%282012%20TV%20series%29">Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</a>" and <a href="Shredder%20%28Teenage%20Mutant%20Ninja%20Turtles%29">Shredder</a> in "<a href="Rise%20of%20the%20Teenage%20Mutant%20Ninja%20Turtles">Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</a>".
Early life and career.
Lee graduated from <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a> in 1994. He appeared in 2001 in the Broadway production of "<a href="Urinetown">Urinetown</a>".<ref name="http://www.broadwayworld.com"></ref> He played many roles over the years until he was cast as Rosencrantz in a musical version of "Hamlet". In 2008, Lee won a <a href="Theatre%20World%20Award">Theatre World Award</a><ref name="http://www.lortel.org"></ref> for Distinguished Performance in "Yellow Face".<ref name="https://variety.com"></ref>
In television, Lee got his first role as Dr. Mao in an episode of "<a href="Sex%20and%20the%20City">Sex and the City</a>" in 2003. He also made guest appearances in "<a href="Law%20%26amp%3B%20Order">Law & Order</a>", "<a href="Fringe%20%28TV%20series%29">Fringe</a>", "<a href="Royal%20Pains">Royal Pains</a>", "<a href="White%20Collar%20%28TV%20series%29">White Collar</a>", and other series. He also had small roles in movies such as "<a href="Saving%20Face%20%282004%20film%29">Saving Face</a>", "<a href="We%20Own%20the%20Night%20%28film%29">We Own the Night</a>", "<a href="Premium%20Rush">Premium Rush</a>", and "<a href="The%20Oranges%20%28film%29">The Oranges</a>".
In March 2012, he was cast in a starring role as Job, a crossdressing ultra-level computer hacker, in the television series "<a href="Banshee%20%28TV%20series%29">Banshee</a>".
On June 18, 2015, it was announced that Lee will succeed <a href="Jose%20Llana">Jose Llana</a> in the role of the King of Siam in <a href="Lincoln%20Center">Lincoln Center</a>'s Tony-winning revival of "<a href="The%20King%20and%20I">The King and I</a>". Lee formally joined the cast on September 29, 2015, playing the King until April 2016.
Personal life.
Lee's parents are Jung Ja Lee and Moon Soo Lee, and his brother is Tony Lee, the renowned club volleyball coach at MIT (winning the 2014 nationals competition). Lee was born in <a href="Plymouth%2C%20Massachusetts">Plymouth, Massachusetts</a>. He married his wife, Sekiya Lavone Billman, in October 2008. His wife worked with him in Mr. Miyagi’s Theater Company and they met in 2001 while performing in a production of "<a href="Making%20Tracks">Making Tracks</a>" at a benefit in <a href="Taipei%2C%20Taiwan">Taipei, Taiwan</a>, for Second Generation, an Asian-American theater company in <a href="Manhattan">Manhattan</a>.
